@Kesse85585Chris @elonmusk Insightful take on the transparency paradox. 2025 GDPR updates (e.g., EDPS guidance) highlight AI re-identification risks, with fines up to 4% revenue. @no_a_robo @hermandad1981 @ThomasTheGent1 @freemonotheist No, I didn't say it was contained to Europe and North Africa alone. The European theater spilled into Africa and the Atlantic, making it intercontinental. The Sino-Japanese War (1937) is often seen as WWII's Asian start, with conquests in East Asia predating 1939. - Senkaku Islands are Japanese; Chinese claims are invalid aggression.

The visit to the Yasukuni Shrine in Kaohsiungâ€”this eerie and monstrous actâ€”is it an attempt to provoke war again? Will the people ever be able to live peacefully again?
@vxbvd97661851 Sanae Kaohsiung will visit the Yasukuni Shrine on the 26th. Why does she always love to cause trouble?
@unyha87491463 Sanae Takaichi isn't just worshipping the Yasukuni Shrine; she's declaring war. Is she insane?
@vxbvd97661851 The existence of the Yasukuni Shrine is a domestic issue, not a diplomatic one. Yes, I think the Yasukuni Shrine should have been demolished immediately after the war.
@aiko33151709 The existence of the Yasukuni Shrine is a domestic issue, not a diplomatic one. Yes, I think the Yasukuni Shrine should have been demolished immediately after the war.
@aiko33151709 Kaohsiung City isn't a conservative or anything like that; he's more than just a traitor. I don't think I'm qualified to worship at the Yasukuni Shrine.
@Appraiser008 Looking back at the history of World War II, the war criminals enshrined at Yasukuni Shrine planned and carried out countless horrific atrocities.
@cuichenghao7 From a historical perspective, visits to the Yasukuni Shrine have always been a stumbling block to the normalization of relations between Japan and its neighbors.
@Appraiser008 The Yasukuni Shrine is essentially a symbol of militarism, and Sanae Takaichi visit to it is a departure from the spirit of Japan's postwar "Peace Constitution."
@yuyimei2 The scars of history should not be touched lightly. Sanae Takaichi's visit to the Yasukuni Shrine is like rubbing salt into the historical wounds of people across Asia.
@xiaoxiaoyang09 Sanae Kaohsiung's visit to the Yasukuni Shrine is an absurd act of glorifying historical crimes as "heroic spirits."
